title: Kinematics - linearizing data to find g

content.description: A student allows a block to slide down a long ramp from various starting positions. The student records the time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for the block to travel a displacement <math alttext="delta x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math> after being released from rest. The student creates a graph of <math alttext="delta x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="t squared" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Based on the data shown in the graph, which of the following is the best estimate of the acceleration of the block down the ramp?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.5 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="1.0 meter per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="4.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.0 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
